questions.question: All of the following are reasons why you would want to settle near the Nile River except...

choices.answer: To Drink
To Bathe
To Hunt
The 3 E's
In the north east corner of Africa along the Nile River
In the north west corner of Africa along the Tigris River
In the south east corner of Africa along the Euphrates River
In the southern part of Africa along the Indian Ocean

questions.question: What are two positives to settling near of Mediterranean Sea?

choices.answer: Trade, Travel, Transportation & Drinking
Fishing and the 3 T's
Drinking & Bathing
Fishing & Cooking

questions.question: What is a positive to having deserts on your boarders?

choices.answer: They are wet
They are filled with animals to hunt
There is a lot of water there to drink
They act as natural barriers to ward off invaders

questions.question: Why wouldn't you want to live near the Dead Sea?

choices.answer: There are too many animals
There are too many plants
Nothing can live there because it is way too salty
It is too far from the nearest Walmart

questions.question: The best type of topograpy to live on would be...

choices.answer: Vallies or plains; they are flat & fertile for farming
Mountains because everyone wants to herd goats
The desert because being hot is fun
On a plateau because it is so difficult to travel down

questions.question: Great uses for vegetation like papyrus are...

choices.answer: To make the roofs of huts
To eat on a daily basis
To make rope and paper
For shade

questions.question: Another reason that the Nile is important to life in Egypt is...

choices.answer: For artistic purposes
To hunt because animals are drawn to water
To play in
To have reenactment battles on

questions.question: Reeds are a type of vegetation that are used for...

choices.answer: Paper & Rope
Food
Their beauty
To weave baskets and the roofs of huts

questions.question: The most positive physical features in Canaan are...

choices.answer: The Dead Sea and Nubian Desert
The Sea of Galilee and Jordan River
The Lebanon Mountains and the Sea of Galilee
The Jordan River and the Dead Sea
